org.numenta.nupic.algorithms

Class SpatialPoolerCompatibilityTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.numenta.nupic.algorithms.SpatialPoolerCompatibilityTest

  • public class SpatialPoolerCompatibilityTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Tests the SpatialPooler output of the Java SP against the generated activations, permanences and connected state of the Python SP. This is accomplished by use of the UniversalRandom RNG in both the Python and Java versions, to produce Python output which is then stored as a Java class file which can return the Python SP's state at any given processing cycle.
    Author:
    cogmission
    See Also:
    SpatialPoolerCompatibilityActives, SpatialPoolerCompatibilityPermanences, UniversalRandom

    • Method Detail

      • testCompatability1

        public void testCompatability1()
        Test the Java output against stored Python output allowing "learning" to be randomly turned on and off. Uses the UniversalRandom RNG in both the Python and Java versions to enable identical output generation.

                                     double b,
                                     int precision)
        Used to specify the number of places after the decimal for which the comparison should be made.
        Parameters:

        b - the second double to compare
        precision - the number of places after the decimal point
        Returns:
        a flag indicating whether the two specified doubles are equal at the specified precision.

                           Connections c,
                           int[][] inputs,
                           int numRecords,
                           SpatialPoolerCompatibilityActives actives,
                           SpatialPoolerCompatibilityPermanences perms)
        Main loop of the test which calls compute and then compares the SpatialPooler's state to the stored test from the Python version of the same test.

        sp - the SpatialPooler
        c - The Connections object
        inputs - the test input data
        numRecords - the number of iterations to run
        actives - the Class storing the Python activations
        perms - the Class storing the Python permanences

                                int[] activations,
                                int iteration)
        Compares the stored python column activations against the column activations of the java SpatialPooler
        Parameters:

        activations - the column activations for the current cycle.
        iteration - the current iteration num

      • convertPermanences

        private void convertPermanences(Connections c,
                                SpatialPooler sp,
                                SpatialPoolerCompatibilityPermanences compats,
                                int iteration)
        Transfer the permanences from source to dest SP's. This is used in test routines to counteract some drift between implementations. We assume the two SP's have identical configurations/parameters.
        Parameters:
        c -
        sp -
        compats -
        iteration -

                                        int iteration)
        Returns the array of persisted Python SP column synapse permanences
        Parameters:
        compats - the generated class which returns the permanences
        iteration - the current iteration
        Returns:
        a 2 dim array containing each column's synapse permanences
